meanings.definition: The state or quality of not being valid.
meanings.sent1: The nonvalidity of the document was evident.
meanings.sent2: The nonvalidity of the contract led to its cancellation.
meanings.sent3: The nonvalidity of the excuse made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The nonvalidity of his argument was like a leaky boat in a storm.
meanings.sent5: The nonvalidity of the theory stood out like a bright red flag.

meanings.definition: Lack of legal force or effectiveness.
meanings.sent1: She pointed out the nonvalidity of the law in question.
meanings.sent2: The nonvalidity of the ruling surprised many.
meanings.sent3: The nonvalidity of the parking ticket was a relief.
meanings.sent4: The nonvalidity of the decision left them stranded in uncertainty.
meanings.sent5: The nonvalidity of the contract was a heavy weight on their shoulders.
